alert.note: Alert for Hickman (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 03 at 9:51AM CST until January 06 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... Duck River At Centerville affecting Hickman County. For the Duck River...including Centerville...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Duck River At Centerville. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Flood waters will cover the flood plain along the river. Several roads near the river will be partially covered. In Centerville, Hickman Springs Road and Defeated Creek Road will be affected. Leatherwood Road between Shady Grove and Primm Springs near Tottys Bend will also be affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Monday the stage was 20.4 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 21.5 feet tomorrow morning. - Action stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 400 AM CST.
